Key Arguments: The legislation restricts freedom of ideas and thoughts, leading to a totalitarian form of control.
Existing laws already address illegal thoughts and actions, making the new legislation unnecessary.
The proposed department to control misinformation could be biased and push personal agendas.
Historical examples show that ideas once considered radical can become accepted truths.
The legislation contradicts the right to freedom of opinion and expression.
